alert.note: Alert for Jasper; Kemper; Lauderdale; Leake; Neshoba; Newton; Scott (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 17 at 6:27PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Leake, northwestern Jasper, Newton, southwestern Kemper, Scott, Neshoba and northwestern Lauderdale Counties through 715 PM CDT... At 626 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Ludlow to near Edinburg. Movement was southeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Edinburg around 630 PM CDT. Philadelphia and Pearl River around 635 PM CDT. Harperville, Hillsboro, Steele and Burnside around 640 PM CDT. Forest around 645 PM CDT. Bethsaida, House, Forestdale and Conehatta around 650 PM CDT. Lawrence and Herbert Springs around 655 PM CDT. Newton, Liberty, Martin, Damascus and Roberts around 700 PM CDT. Prismatic around 705 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Lena, Tucker, Walnut Grove, Lake, Sebastopol and Standing Pine. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for central and east central Mississippi.

area.areaDesc: Jasper; Kemper; Lauderdale; Leake; Neshoba; Newton; Scott
